{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3044394,"name":"Joshua Doyle","username":"jdoyle12","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e9a140/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-04-15T18:24:12.166Z","cooked":"

Hello I’m the programmer for my team and we are trying to use a ELP USB camera for driving. The problem is the frames per second only reach around 8 frames per second. For code its

UsbCamera camera = CameraServer.startAutomaticCapture();
camera.setExposureManual(1);
camera.setVideoMode(PixelFormat.kMJPEG, 160, 120, 30);

Any help greatly appreciated.

We are testing with this to. In our experience, the best out of the box solution is to use the labview dashboard to load the stream. We are testing out some javascript to read/render the stream with 0 buffer that seems to have equal, if not better, performance than the labview dashboard.

You may find this page useful.

github.com

GitHub - aruntj/mjpeg-readable-stream: Code to read an Mjpeg stream using the...

Code to read an Mjpeg stream using the Readable stream api. - GitHub - aruntj/mjpeg-readable-stream: Code to read an Mjpeg stream using the Readable stream api.

Have you checked the status return of camera.setVideoMode? Have you tried calling getActualFPS?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-04-15T18:51:29.304Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":75,"readers_count":74,"score":35.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":408972,"topic_slug":"help-with-elp-camera-for-driving","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://first.wpi.edu/wpilib/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/cscore/VideoSource.html#setVideoMode(edu.wpi.first.cscore.VideoMode)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"VideoSource (WPILib API 2022.4.1)","clicks":5},{"url":"https://first.wpi.edu/wpilib/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/cscore/VideoSource.html#getActualFPS()","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"VideoSource (WPILib API 2022.4.1)","clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-elp-camera-for-driving/408972/3","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3044406,"name":"","username":"Berkeli","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/b/ba8739/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-04-15T19:07:20.288Z","cooked":"

We weren’t able to set the ELP to our desired settings using the setVideoMode method and instead ended up using the following code.
In our variable declaration area:
mjpegServer1.setSource(intakeCamera); mjpegServer1.setResolution(160,120); mjpegServer1.setFPS(10); CameraServer.putVideo("Intake Camera", 160, 120);

In our initialize function (runs on startup):
private UsbCamera intakeCamera = new UsbCamera("USB Camera 0", 0); private MjpegServer mjpegServer1 = new MjpegServer("Intake Camera", 1181);

It seems the ELP only supports a fixed number of video modes, of which 160x120 resolution is not available. Using these settings we get reasonably low latency with ~.6 mps used. We could bump up our framerate a bit, but our driver cares a lot more about latency than framerate so we haven’t tried that.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2022-04-15T19:07:20.288Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":59,"readers_count":58,"score":66.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":408972,"topic_slug":"help-with-elp-camera-for-driving","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50125,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer & Strategist"},"post_url":"/t/help-with-elp-camera-for-driving/408972/4","custom_user_title":"Programmer & Strategist","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3044425,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2022-04-15T19:36:40.071Z","cooked":"

You can see the video modes the camera supports on the camera server webpage: CameraServer Web Interface — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

If you’re using a mode the camera doesn’t support, then the roboRIO is scaling the image, which increases latency. The lowest latency approach is to use a video mode the camera supports, assuming it fits within the bandwidth limits.
